import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react'; import LogoutConfirmationModal from '../AngajatComponent/LogoutConfirmationModal'; import { useNavigate } from 'react-router-dom'; import { useLocation } from 'react-router-dom'; function AdminHomePage() { const location = useLocation(); const { numeAngajat, prenumeAngajat } = location.state || {}; const navigate = useNavigate(); const [showLogoutConfirmation, setShowLogoutConfirmation] = useState(false); const [employees, setEmployees] = useState([]); const getAdminEmployees = () => { fetch('http://localhost:5036/api/DateCompleteAngajat') .then((response) => { if (response.ok) { return response.json(); } else { throw new Error('Failed to fetch data'); } }) .then((data) => { // Filter employees with isAdmin = true const isAdminEmployees = data.filter((employee) => employee.isAdmin); setEmployees(isAdminEmployees); }) .catch((error) => { console.error('Error fetching data:', error); }); }; const BlogPostList = () => { const [blogPosts, setBlogPosts] = useState([]); const fetchBlogPosts = () => { fetch('http://localhost:5188/api/ResourcesBlogPosts') .then((response) => { if (response.ok) { return response.json(); } else { throw new Error('Failed to fetch blog posts'); } }) .then((data) => { setBlogPosts(data); }) .catch((error) => { console.error('Error fetching blog posts:', error); }); }; useEffect(() => { fetchBlogPosts(); }, []); useEffect(() => { getAdminEmployees(); }, []); const handleLogout = () => { setShowLogoutConfirmation(true); }; const handleConfirmLogOut = () => { setShowLogoutConfirmation(false); navigate('/'); }; const handleCancelLogOut = () => { setShowLogoutConfirmation(false); }; return (
{ e.preventDefault(); navigate("/adminHomePage", { state: {numeAngajat: numeAngajat, prenumeAngajat: prenumeAngajat}, }); }}>
Welcome back, {numeAngajat} {prenumeAngajat}!

Hertz

Welcome to your work space. We are glad that you are here.

{/* Blog entries */} {/* Blog entry content */} {/* Blog entry 1 */}

WORK RESPONSIBLY

Your Path to Success and Integrity

Embracing responsibility at work is the key to a successful, ethical, and health-conscious career. When you prioritize responsibility, you not only build trust with your colleagues and clients but also consistently deliver excellence in your tasks, while also safeguarding your physical and mental well-being. It's a path that leads to personal growth, integrity, and a balanced, healthy work-life dynamic. So, let responsibility be your guiding light on the journey to success and overall well-being.

{/* Blog entry 2 */}

PROTECT YOUR DATA

Prioritize data security in the digital age to safeguard your sensitive information from cyber threats.

In today's digital age, safeguarding your data is more critical than ever. With the constant threat of cyberattacks and data breaches, it's essential to take proactive measures to protect your sensitive information. Data security involves a combination of strong, unique passwords, regular updates and patches for your software and devices, and being cautious when sharing personal information online. Additionally, consider using encryption tools and reputable antivirus software to further enhance your data protection. By adopting these practices, you can significantly reduce the risk of falling victim to data breaches and maintain the privacy and security of your valuable information.

Avoid storing personal data on your work devices. Also, do not leave papers on your desk unattended. If you no longer need specific information, it is recommended to use paper shredders so that sensitive data will be securely destroyed when no longer needed. For storing passwords it is mandatory to use a password manager.

{/* Blog entry 3 */}

WE ARE ALL TOGETHER

Teamwork makes the dream work! We all need to help each other!

In the workplace, fostering a sense of unity and cooperation is essential for our collective success. We understand that every team member plays a crucial role, and by extending a helping hand, we can all contribute to a more productive and harmonious work environment.

Collaboration is not just a concept; it's a daily practice. One of the fundamental aspects of this practice is the willingness to ask questions. Asking questions is important, as it not only demonstrates your commitment to understanding and contributing but also allows others to share their knowledge and experiences. By asking questions, we encourage open communication and create an atmosphere where everyone feels valued and supported.

Moreover, offering assistance when needed is a testament to our commitment to each other's growth and achievement. It's a simple yet powerful gesture that can lead to higher productivity and job satisfaction. Whether it's lending a hand on a challenging project or sharing expertise, helping each other is a fundamental part of our workplace culture.

In the end, the slogan "We all need to help each other" embodies our dedication to teamwork, collaboration, and a collective pursuit of success. It reminds us that by working together and supporting one another, we can achieve greatness in our shared endeavors.

DON'T FALL BEHIND

Make use of LinkedIn Learning

Team Hertz is excited to announce that we've taken a significant step to enhance your professional growth. We've recently introduced LinkedIn Learning accounts for our valued members. With our new offering, you can now access a vast library of online courses and tutorials designed to help you acquire new skills and further your career. We believe that continuous learning is key to success, and we're delighted to provide you with this valuable resource. So, don't wait make use of LinkedIn Learning and embark on a journey of personal and professional development today. Your future is full of possibilities, and this is your opportunity to unlock them.

{/* Introduction menu */} {/* Introduction 1 */}

Leonardo Bajdechi

Software developer and creator of our work environment - the Hertz App. He is the reason that all your tasks and resources are organized and protected, within an easy-to-use application, dedicated to everyone and with one of the biggest communities in the car industry. He loves working in a team, having fun with everyone, learning every day, and helping others with anything they need.

{/* Posts */}

Meet the team
